headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Gains More Than 500 Points; Spotify Hits A Buy Point (Live Coverage)
summary: Stocks posted another day of strong gains Friday, fueled by news of potential progress toward the U.S. and China mending trade relations.  Indexes shrugged off an earnings sell-off for Apple and focused instead on a better-than-expected April jobs report on the stock market today.  The indexes peaked after The Wall Street Journal reported China is considering a fentanyl offer to the U.S. to start trade talks.

headline: US exceptionalism trade is 'still in play': May investing tips
summary: Markets (^GSPC, ^IXIC, ^DJI) are shifting as investors weigh hot labor data and lingering inflation against long-term growth strategies. Andrew Briggs, CFP and Wealth Advisor at Steward Partners, shares why staying invested and reassessing exposure to the Magnificent Seven — the group of tech stocks comprised of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA), Amazon (AMZN), Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT) — may be key in navigating today’s uncertainty. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: The Dow jumps 450 points as a strong jobs report has Trump calling for interest rate cuts again
summary: U.S. stocks opened higher Friday morning following a better than expected April jobs report. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 450 points, or 1.1%. The S&P 500 also gained 1% to extend its recent winning streak, and the Nasdaq added 0.9% following a spate of Big Tech earnings this week.

headline: TSX futures positive on calming trade tensions, positive U.S. jobs report

headline: Jobs report, China trade, Apple & Amazon earnings: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rallying behind the April jobs report's employment data, which saw the US economy outdo economists' forecasts and add 177,000 non-farm payroll jobs. Chinese officials are reportedly pondering trade negotiations with the US. Amazon stock (AMZN) is slightly up in Friday pre-market trading and Apple stock (AAPL) is down after the tech giants reported earnings yesterday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
